intro: Ornithogalum iraqense, commonly known as the Iraq star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Iraq and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Ornithogalum iraqense is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance.
